alert.note: Alert for Covington; Jones (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 29 at 10:55PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Covington and western Jones Counties through 1130 PM CST... At 1055 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sanford, or 9 miles southeast of Collins, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Moselle around 1110 PM CST. Hebron around 1115 PM CST. Ellisville around 1120 PM CST. Laurel around 1125 PM CST. Other locations impacted by this storm include Seminary and Soso. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for south central Mississippi. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 600 AM CST for southeastern and east central Mississippi.
